intro: Cephalophora peraltae, commonly known as the Peralta's beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the plant family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique floral structure supports pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it an important species in its native ecosystem.
